column4: Im fine with apt but just wonder why aptitude is not included from the start with ubuntu
could someone answer the question I just asked?
about default package installation? good luck
sorry i thought your question was about aptitude not being installed by default or something
yeahh I wonder why aptitude dosn't come default installed with ubuntu
you will not really be able to get that sort of question addressed here, IMHO
hehehe okej, do you know why?
pure speculation: apt-get is more basic, less things can go wrong. aptitude is a bigger package, more complex, more things could go wrong. idk just guessing
thought that ubuntu maybe never installs per default twp packages that does the same job
okej thanks, Im new with ubuntu, Im used to use debian. there both apt and aptitude comes as default
i recommend going back to debian. i dont' like ubuntu.
ah ok. hope you enjoy it then :)
As Im going to do what you already have done, wonder which parts of ubuntu do you think is not good compared to debian
many small issues. it seems they are very negligent of features that coders / "power users" use. i have had problems with ALT+TAB, for instance
which language do you program in?
